qas.question: Which group supported by Russia entered Balta in 1768?
Near what region was Balta bording?
During what years was the Russo-Turkish war?
The Russo-Turkish War resulted in what treaty?
The culmination of the Russo-Turkish war granted what to the citizens of Ottoman controlled Provinces in Moldavia?

context: In 1768 Russian-backed <a0_0>Ukrainian Haidamaks<a0_0/>, pursuing Polish confederates, entered Balta, an Ottoman-controlled town on the border of <a1_0>Bessarabia<a1_0/> in Ukraine, and massacred its citizens and burned the town to the ground. This action provoked the Ottoman Empire into the Russo-Turkish War of <a2_0>1768–1774<a2_0/>. The <a3_0>Treaty of Küçük Kaynarca<a3_0/> of 1774 ended the war and provided <a4_0>freedom to worship<a4_0/> for the Christian citizens of the Ottoman-controlled provinces of Wallachia and Moldavia. By the late 18th century, a number of defeats in several wars with Russia led some people in the Ottoman Empire to conclude that the reforms of Peter the Great had given the Russians an edge, and the Ottomans would have to keep up with Western technology in order to avoid further defeats.
